Translated by Tripiá¹­aka Master Dharmaraká¹£a of the Western Jin
Hears this sort of: once the Buddha was traveling in the land established by the TathÄgata, called the profound Dharma body
Delightful, universally seen pavilion, for great adornment and purity, shining brightly in the palace of majesty, the storehouse of lapis lazuli, the place where the TathÄgata acts.

The Buddha then arises from the immeasurable path, for the palace of the Dharma realm, observing the body of the bodhisattva, the pure light of the lion's seat, all receiving the body of all bodhisattvas, for the great Dharma seat.

Praising the holy intent of the Dharma realm TathÄgata, relying on the realm of space, practicing without obstruction, understanding the realm of the holy wisdom of the fundamental reality, universally understanding the Buddha's wisdom, discerning the holy path.
The Buddhas of the past, future, and present are all equal, being a single Dharma body;
The practices of all Buddhas are all equal, the practice of spiritual powers is unobstructed.
The body of wisdom of the Dharma body is ultimately without characteristics;

The Dharma is limitless, and one roams in the Dharma realm without dualistic practices. Profound, vast, and limitless, it is the supreme right enlightenment. Being equal like a scale, one transcends practices and has no obstructions, and the gate of liberation is unlocked.
The Dharma realm is universally the same as empty space;
One always roams in the buddha lands of the ten directions, and because it is limitless, there is nothing that is not seen.

Billions of bodhisattvas, as numerous as dust motes, are all in their last lifetime, each in a different buddha world, with boundless aspirations and upholding various wisdom practices, each entering the indestructible and impartial Dharma realm.
The realm of emptiness is limitless, with nothing to attain, no intermediate practices, no naturalness, and no arising;
Understanding and realizing all dharmas is also like this.

The bodies of the bodhisattvas were unmoving, and they attained spiritual powers and pervaded all buddha lands without thought, following the wisdom of the TathÄgata, and presently attained the illumination of the Buddha's path.

They roamed in the great sage's conduct without shaking, and with wisdom they manifested countless bodies, and their conduct pervaded the boundless Dharma realm, distinguishing the realm of sentient beings who are good people and reaching irreversibility.

Equally attaining the original limit, the Dharma realm without basis, removing self-importance, the body always humble and compliant, then fearless, the TathÄgata illuminating all the roots of virtue as his followers.
Their names were:

Samantabhadra Bodhisattva, Bodhisattva of Universal Renown, Bodhisattva of the TathÄgata's Clan and Surname, Bodhisattva of the Foremost Vajra Banner, Bodhisattva of Uncovered Moon Purity, Bodhisattva of Sun-Light and Stainless Treasury, Bodhisattva of Great Divine Powers and Transformations, Bodhisattva of Stainless Light and Foremost, Bodhisattva of the King of Diligence in the Ten Directions, and Bodhisattva of the Great Lion's Play and Divine Powers.
Such a group was like the countless koá¹­is of nayutas of dust motes in the buddha lands of the ten directions, with an assembly of bodhisattvas numbering in the same way.

There was then a light called the Holy Intention of the TathÄgata. The World-Honored One emitted this radiance from between his eyebrows, illuminating countless koá¹­Ä«s of nayutas of worlds without limit or remainder in the ten directions, manifesting the spiritual transformations of the TathÄgata, and announcing to the countless koá¹­Ä«s of nayutas of bodhisattvas, whose spiritual powers then caused all the evil destinies in the Buddha worlds to be extinguished, and overshadowed all the palaces of the mÄras.

Moreover, the TathÄgatas, having attained perfect enlightenment, awakened those who were not yet awakened, manifesting the assembly and Dharma seat of the Buddhas, the radiance emitted from the pure seat, illuminating the Dharma realm and the ultimate empty realm, pervading everywhere in the Buddha realms, and then returning, all circumambulating the seats of all bodhisattvas, and disappearing into the crown of the bodhisattva RÄá¹£á¹­rapÄla.
In this assembly, all the bodhisattvas marveled at the unprecedented event, their bodies and minds leaping with joy:
Today there will be an immeasurable transformation, expounding the great Dharma, and such light naturally appears.

As soon as the light disappeared, the bodhisattva Supreme of the TathÄgata's Clan immediately rose from his seat, descended from the lotus flower, knelt on his right knee, joined his palms, contemplated the virtues of the TathÄgata, and spoke in verse, saying:
Awakening those who are not yet awakened, surpassing the kings of all virtues,
His practice is unobstructed, his arising is of supreme liberation.
The Great Sage abides in peace, equal in the three times,
With reverence I now bow my head to the wise and sagacious one.
His practice has no form or characteristics, yet he has crossed to the other shore,
And yet he manifests, well adorning his physical form.
His light is free from defilements, revealing hundreds of thousands of radiances,
Subjugating all demonic affairs, I pay homage with the crown of my head.
Shaking the lands of various countries, the foremost of palaces,
And extending to the ten directions, all the lands,
Never causing a single person to experience fear,
The majestic spiritual power of the Buddha's Way arises like this.
Equally establishing in the realm of space,
The Dharma realm is like this, attaining all lands.
Purifying the multitudes, as numerous as dust motes in the billion-koá¹­i realms;
Eliminating all the offenses and faults of sentient beings.
Aspirations are extremely firm, practicing for billions and trillions of kalpas,
Cultivating and accumulating merit, the supreme Buddha Way.
Attaining the single practice, the unobstructed holy wisdom;
With the single naturalness, all practicing the Buddha Way.
The radiance emitted is like this, the guide is like this,
Universally seeing the Saha world, all without exception;
Universally manifesting all, the majestic spiritual transformations,
I have already attained entry into the single natural practice.
For this reason, I give rise to such thoughts:
'Now is the time to bow to the Dharma King.
Innumerable bodhisattvas have all come and gathered here,
Wishing to listen and contemplate the Dharma matters that are distinguished.
Those who gather here today are pure and even purer,
And in the various worlds, they closely follow and practice.
The holy wisdom is immeasurable, and the realm is unobstructed,
Attaining the courageous and boundless majestic spiritual powers.
These ones roam the worldly affairs, their practices reaching the divine immortals,
Their wisdom is incalculable, surpassing the power of diligent practice,
And emitted light, illuminating all the bodhisattvas.
Now I ask as appropriate:
'The supreme and most excellent Dharma, the realm that can be borne,ğŸ”½For this, the Great Sage communicates, freely displaying his majestic radiance,
And universally manifests everywhere.
The guide, the most exalted one!ğŸ”½Proclaiming the various buddha lands, who is the sage among humans,
The true son of the highest?'

Having spoken this praise in verse, at that time the World-Honored One emitted light from his mouth, called 'Illuminating Incalculable Billions,' which illuminated all the boundless buddha worlds, circled the buddha lands ten times, manifested the majestic transformations of the TathÄgata's holy will, summoned countless billions of myriads of koá¹­Ä«s of bodhisattvas, all of whom were instructed, shook the buddha lands, reached all the evil destinies and extinguished all calamities, and overshadowed all the palaces of MÄra.
The TathÄgatas of the ten directions equally and rightly awaken to all that is not yet awakened, manifesting the assemblies and sites of enlightenment of all Buddhas.

The radiance extends throughout the Dharma realm, pervading all worlds in the cosmos, reaching all Buddha-lands, and then returning to circle around the bodhisattvas, entering the mouth of Samantabhadra Bodhisattva.

As soon as Samantabhadra Bodhisattva encounters this light, he immediately responds accordingly, and his merit, majestic appearance, and lion seat become twice as great as beforeâ€”surpassing the Buddha's body and lion seat, and also surpassing the bodies and lion seats of all the bodhisattvas.
Samantabhadra Bodhisattva's demeanor, beauty, and lion seat are lofty, vast, and exceptionally wonderful, manifesting as particularly magnificent.
At that time, Bodhisattva Foremost of the TathÄgata's Clan asked Samantabhadra, saying:
Yes, Son of the Buddha!
Your merit is inconceivable, and you know all worlds completely.
Arise and transform, delighting the bodhisattvas, with boundless movement. Now, Buddha's disciple!
The transformation that the TathÄgata manifests is a sign of the auspicious response.
The Bodhisattva Samantabhadra said to the Bodhisattva Supreme of TathÄgata's Clan:
As I remember, and as seen by the equally enlightened ones of the past, such boundless transformations and movements will be expounded in the TathÄgata's Manifestation and Flourishing SÅ«tra.
Now, the Great Sage wishes to expound this meaning, and therefore again manifests such auspicious signs.
As soon as the Bodhisattva Supreme of TathÄgata's Clan heard the name of this Manifestation and Flourishing SÅ«tra, the earth immediately shook greatly due to the Buddha's majestic spiritual power.
Then, the Bodhisattva Supreme of TathÄgata's Clan said to Samantabhadra:
Excellent, Buddha's disciple!
You are able and willing to praise for the bodhisattvas and great beings the manifestation and flourishing of the TathÄgata, the Worthy One, the Perfectly Enlightened One.
Now, the ten directions are all pure and vast, with innumerable hundreds of thousands of koá¹­is of nayutas of assemblies coming together.

In the past, they cultivated pure practices well, with a place to return to in their minds, embracing morality and virtue, manifesting the intention of enlightenment, expounding great words, and transcending to the other shore.

They established all the practices, deportment, and etiquette of the TathÄgatas, always thinking of the Buddhas without ever forgetting or abandoning them, giving rise to great compassion, and universally observing sentient beings.

The great bodhisattvas have thoroughly understood spiritual powers, distinguished all the TathÄgatas' diligence, are tranquil in themselves, and have heard the sounds of the Way and the sublime Dharma praised by all Buddhas.
Such a group of people with merits and fame, equally eliminating all likes and dislikes without any preference, are now all gathered in this assembly.
You are the Buddha's disciples, having already made offerings to innumerable hundreds of thousands of koá¹­is of nayutas of Buddhas, bowing your heads to consult and receive them;
They had all already practiced the bodhisattva path, attained great spiritual powers, various samÄdhi gates, and enjoyed spiritual penetrations, and all entered the TathÄgata's secret treasury;
They eliminated all doubts and entered the TathÄgata's fearless diligence, and probed into the various faculties of sentient beings;
They all spoke the sÅ«tras with faith in true liberation, and reached the TathÄgata's movement;
The holy nature to which they returned proclaimed the Buddha's teachings, which were the foremost in attaining ultimate liberation.
Such types were innumerable, with extraordinary virtues.
Excellent, O Buddha's disciple!

Please speak of the TathÄgata's manifestation of his body, the vast sounds he emits, the mental activities and realms he expounds, the practices he praises that lead to perfect enlightenment, the turning of the Dharma wheel, the transmission of the Buddha's teachings, the great parinirvÄá¹‡a he displays, and the demonstration of the TathÄgata's entire virtuous basis and all his practices.
At that time, the Bodhisattva of the Foremost Clan of the TathÄgatas, wishing to explain the meaning again and distinguish the return, spoke in verse to the Bodhisattva Samantabhadra, saying:
Returning well without union, understanding and fully awakening to the truth,
His wisdom is unsurpassed, equal and free from desires.
Praising the most supreme, his practice is immeasurable,
Hearing his sound, all rejoice.
How does the special Bodhisattva arise in victory?
Why is he able to return and seek refuge? For what reasons does he attain the truth?
What is the sound of the TathÄgata? What is called the body and mind?
What is the realm of his practice? What is this great praise?
What is called the buddhas, and why is it called the TathÄgata?
Why is he called the most supreme, and why does he turn the Dharma wheel?
Please explain the ground of peaceful abiding and nirvÄá¹‡a for the assembly,
You should delight these countless Buddha sons.
Those who abide in the ten directions, the great Dharma kings,
All sentient beings, the recipients of merit and virtue.
The blessings and merits of these, the Great Sage should explain for them,
What are the causes for seeing the intention of the Way?
How does one attain peace and stability?
How can one hear the names of the TathÄgatas?
Never before have we seen the great sages who have entered parinirvÄá¹‡a,
If we give rise to joy and reverence for the honored sages,
Please explain with delight, what are the causes for accomplishing the great intention?
Now I ask this of you, the pure great person!
Please explain what is practiced, the great virtue of the great ocean.
Observe these bodhisattvas, all with palms joined,
Asking the Buddha, the benevolent one, and also inquiring of me.
For their sake, I will proclaim the pure and sublime Dharma,
In order to sever the doubts of the multitude and attain immeasurable great wisdom.
I will use parables to illustrate the Buddha's lineage,
So that if sentient beings hear it, they will give rise to the pure aspiration for enlightenment.
Cause all buddha-lands to be completely supreme without remainder,
And the buddhas will universally manifest various kinds of physical forms.
Those who know the pure Dharma will expound it in accordance with the appropriate time,
Using their clan and parables to demonstrate and explain it.
Going to buddha-lands in the ten directions, hundreds of thousands,
Billions and hundreds of nayutas in number, immeasurable and incalculable,
Difficult to encounter and see, such bodhisattvas,
Like those gathered here today, are sovereign and supreme.
Therefore, I wish to speak of it, abiding in pure practice,
Thus widely proclaiming and elucidating, the clan and surname of the TathÄgata.
These and other bodhisattvas, all standing with palms joined,
Universally aspiring to seek the Dharma, thirsting for the scriptures.
Samantabhadra Bodhisattva, in response to the question of the TathÄgata's clan and surname, universally announced to the assembly of all bodhisattvas:
Yes, most excellent ones!
The inconceivable, suchness, and perfect enlightenment of the TathÄgatas, if they arise, expound immeasurable narrations of the Dharma sequence, which cannot be measured.
The TathÄgata's flourishing and majestic presence is like this. Although using a single matter, he does not return to the Way using a single matter.
Why is this?
Only the title of the Buddha.
There are also ten matters that are the immeasurable Dharma's return to incalculable hundreds of thousands of merits, cultivating practice to attain the TathÄgata.
What are the ten?
The mind of the Way is immeasurable, universally protecting the intentions of all beings and the thoughts of accumulating good conduct from the past;
The disposition is limitless, originally pure;
Gathering the infinite great compassion and great pity, and practicing to save sentient beings;
The vows and practices are bottomless, continuously cultivating boundless blessings and wisdom;
Practicing without weariness, practicing and returning to the truth;
Teaching and transforming sentient beings, the boundless Buddha treasury;
Also practicing and returning to the pure truth;
The path of immeasurable skillful means and wisdom;
Paying homage to immeasurable virtues and the limitless path;
The practices and wisdom of the sages gather together, embracing the boundless Dharma treasury of meanings and scriptures.
Therefore, Buddha's disciples!
The ten dharmas and practices are the foremost of the Dharma.
Having already perfected the ten, the innumerable hundreds of thousands of retinues and branches return to the TathÄgata.
It is like, Buddha's disciples!
The reason why the thousand worlds are named is not because of a single event, but because of the combination of countless events.
It is like a great cloud that does not miss the right time to rain, and there are four causes and conditions for the winds to blow and spread:
The wind named control has a large wind field with many waters that lead and control the rain;
There is a wind named drying up that burns the water;
There is a wind named abiding that abides in all the palaces;
The wind named adornment travels together with the merits and demerits of the sentient beings in the three thousand worlds.
The merits and virtues accomplished by the bodhisattvas are also like this, immeasurable and incalculable;
It is like establishing the three thousand worlds in various ways to attain the dharmas, but no one can analyze and count them, measure their origins and ends, or see to the end of their source.
Thus, O Buddha's disciple!
The TathÄgata, Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened One does not appear for a single matter or a single meaning.

Moreover, from the past, he has first given rise to the vast Dharma rain of the TathÄgatas, his mind reveres the teachings without weariness, his will and nature are firm and strong, he upholds them without forgetting, he is not confused or agitated, and observes in tranquility.
With the wisdom of the Way, he dries up all the desires of afflictions, encourages the cultivation of the roots of various merits, and skillfully advances, eliminating arrogance.
He discerns and understands the pure practices, expounds the teachings, and purifies the virtues of the masses.

The TathÄgata's meritorious virtue, the source of the Way, is without outflows. Embracing such a TathÄgata, a Perfectly Enlightened One, he attains all dharmas, and there is no one who appears for him. This is entering the first gate, where the practices of the bodhisattvas reach the place where the TathÄgata appears.
Furthermore, child of the Buddha!

It is like the natural flourishing of the trichiliocosm, where a great cloud named indestructible suddenly appears and rains down. The other lands are unable to bear and receive this water, only the trichiliocosm when it undergoes a watery transformation.
In this way, good man!

The Dharma realm of the Buddha has a vast Dharma-rain named indestructible, which collects the TathÄgata and does not cut off the Buddha's lineage, as well as the sages, all Å›rÄvakas and pratyekabuddhas who are unable to bear and uphold it.
Only bodhisattvas with great power, fearless minds, and a vow to don the armor of virtue can do so. These are the two things.
Then he spoke in verse:
Listen clearly, all in the ten directions, supreme in all worlds,
Seeking comparison, there is no equal, likened to empty space.
The practice of the guide is immeasurable, boundless,
Then it becomes without peer, its virtues all pervasive.
If one contemplates the Buddha, with the mind as the basis,
The merits of these ten directions are immeasurable.
The words of the multitude, praised for hundreds of thousands of kalpas,
The lion among men is unsurpassed, with no equal in the world.
All the buddha lands in the ten directions,
Crushed into dust, with as many kalpas as there are dust motes,
Again like hundreds of thousands of koá¹­is, praising the ten directions,
One cannot fully praise the merits of a single hair.
If there is a man who wants to weigh the sky,
The second person quickly calculates the characteristics of the aggregates,
The immeasurable and incalculable cannot exhaust the sky,
One should know that the ten directions are practiced without limit.
If the people of the three times, those in the three realms,
Designing the mind's thoughts and actions of these beings,
The mind's momentary thoughts can all be known in detail,
The various thoughts and mental activities of the multitude of beings.
Just like the Dharma realm, which has no boundaries,
Yet one does not see the direction of the entire Dharma realm.
The Ten Powers are also like this, their practice is immeasurable,
All are non-existent, the Dharma realm is naturally so.
Just like when it rains heavily, it is called indestructible,
No one can bear it, only a flood can contain it.
The Buddha's boundless grace, the Lesser Vehicle cannot bear it,
Only Bodhisattvas can uphold it, spreading it everywhere.
Without basis, like without basis, tranquil, without dualistic thoughts,
Forever unborn, this is called universal equality.
The same is true of all worldly realms,
Without basis, equal, and spontaneous, Already liberated from increase and decrease.
Just like this fundamental limit, The true fundamental limit is without limit,
Equal to the three times, Universally liberating everything.
Compassion is equal to this, The practice of the guide,
Extending throughout the three times, Without any obstruction whatsoever.
The fundamental limit is without creation, Without creation, able to be spontaneous,
Originally pure like empty space, Without defilement, without afflictions.
The most victorious manifests like this, All are completely pure,
Already abandoning creation and non-creation, Discarding existence and non-existence.
Releasing the sounds of words and phrases, And all sounds and echoes,
Eliminating the past and future, NirvÄá¹‡a without any existence.
All the ten directions are like this, Naturally in the Dharma,
All words are without sound, and also cannot be upheld.
Thus, in pure silence, one understands all dharmas,
Like bird tracks in the sky, or a stone in empty space.
Based on the original vows, one manifests a physical body,
And observes oneself in the ten directions, the supreme transformations.
If one wishes to enter this, this supreme realm,
One should be mindful and follow the Way, purifying one's intentions.
Controlling and abandoning all thoughts, in mindfulness there is also no mindfulness,
Like bird tracks in empty space, the mind enters in this way.
Therefore, Ä€nanda!
Contemplate the conduct of the guides, listen to what I say, and carefully bring forth various parables.
Considering the ten directions, the merits and virtues are inexhaustible,
How much more so for speaking of their meaning and praising the sagely and venerable ones?
Just like those sentient beings, they naturally attain their bodies,
But are unable to contemplate and reckon the practices of the guides.
The fruits of the realms of the ten directions, the Buddha's path is unsurpassed,
Accomplishing all virtuous roots, listen to the explanation of all virtues.
Now appearing in this world, contemplate and practice without remainder,
Never contemplating what is suitable, gathering and relying on causes and conditions.
The words in a billion lands, the sounds combining billions and millions,
The reason for calling it the world, establishing the three thousand realms;
The supreme among people is like this, these are all natural,
Unable to reckon and expound the virtues, as they are all-pervading.
Always able to proclaim and spread the thoughts of all sentient beings,
Unable to know the natural practices of the honored one among people.
Furthermore, child of the Buddha!
Just as this rain comes from nowhere and goes nowhere, yet brings this moisture;
It is because of the sins and merits of these beings that they are born.
Thus, Buddha's disciples!

The arising and flourishing of the TathÄgata's teaching of the Way comes from nowhere and goes nowhere, yet it brings the rain of the Dharma, all of which is the power of the various roots of virtue of the bodhisattvas. This is the third matter.
Then he spoke in verse:
Just as the rain comes from nowhere and goes nowhere,
The Buddha's transformation of all is also like this, with no coming and no going.
Furthermore, Buddha's disciples!

It is like a great rain covering the trichiliocosm, and no one can count or know the number of its raindrops. Suppose the beings in a buddha-land think of vast blessings, their minds and eyes are confused, and only the lord knows. The lord of the rain in the trichiliocosm knows all the numbers, not missing a single drop, all due to the virtue of his past roots.
In this way, good man!

All beings, Å›rÄvakas, and pratyekabuddhas cannot understand, contemplate, or observe the Dharma rain of the TathÄgata. They cannot think of or embrace the great mind. If they were to hear of this great mind, they would become confused.
Only the great beings, the bodhisattvas, who have cultivated the path well under past buddhas and attained the unsurpassed power can know it. This is the fourth.
Then he spoke in verse:
Just as there is a great rain covering the buddha lands of the trichiliocosm,
Only the honored celestial sons know, the rest are unable to distinguish.
Calculating all the Å›rÄvakas and pratyekabuddha vehicles,
They do not understand the Buddha's Dharma rain, only the bodhisattvas can know it.
Furthermore, child of the Buddha!
When a great cloud arises, there is also a rain-cloud called 'Elimination,' which extinguishes the fire;
There is a great rain called 'Confusion,' which destroys the water disaster;
There is also a great rain called 'Cutting Off,' which cuts off the wind;
There is also a great rain called 'Destruction,' which destroys the great treasure;
There is also a great rain called 'Dissolution,' which then dissolves the trichiliocosm.
The TathÄgata is like this, appearing in the world, with a great Dharma rain called 'Elimination,' expounding the Dharma's moisture, eliminating all the desires of dust and toil;
It is also called 'Accumulated Karma,' expounding the Dharma's moisture, accumulating all the roots of the myriad virtues;
It is also called 'eliminating and expounding the Dharma's grace, cutting off all sixty-two views;
It is also called 'destroying and expounding the Dharma's grace, enabling the wisdom of all dharmas;
It is also called 'digesting and expounding the Dharma's grace, transforming and extinguishing all mental activities.' This is the fifth.
Then he spoke a verse, saying:
Like rain extinguishing fire, rain destroys the calamity of water,
Like rain cutting off wind, destroying the great jeweled mountain;
When the TathÄgata appears in the world, he extinguishes all greed and desire,
Accumulating the roots of various merits, eliminating the sixty-two views,
The Dharma rain in the ten directions accomplishes all wisdom,
Transforming the dispositions of sentient beings, causing them to follow the right path.
Causing them not to be stingy with the four elements, the three realms have no root or origin,
Naturally having boundless compassion, the three insights are unobstructed.
Furthermore, child of the Buddha!
Just as the rain has one flavor, but when it nourishes the limitless, it moistens everywhere;

The TathÄgata is like this. With one great compassion, he rains on all, causing them to reach the boundless. The Dharma's moisture is all-pervasive. He embraces the Great Sage. Therefore, it is said that the TathÄgata distinguishes and manifests the immeasurable Dharma. This is the sixth matter.
Here, he praises in verse:
Just as the rain has one flavor, but it universally moistens,
The TathÄgata is also like this. His practice is impartial and without partiality.
He then uses one great compassion to rain on all people.
The Dharma's moisture reaches the boundless, universally embracing the Great Way.
Furthermore, child of the Buddha!

Just as when the trichiliocosm is restored, it first forms the bodies and palaces of the devas in the form realm, then it forms the abodes of the worldly humans in the desire realm, and only then does it accomplish the various kinds of beings.

The TathÄgata is like this. When he appears in the world, he first accomplishes the wisdom of the bodhisattvas, then subsequently expounds the wisdom and practices of the pratyekabuddhas, and then displays the wisdom and practices of the Å›rÄvakas' virtues. He then shows the wisdom and practices that should be cultivated by the accumulated good roots of other beings.
The Dharma is of one taste, but it manifests in various ways according to the good roots and dwellings that beings enjoy. Some do not use it.

The flavor of the TathÄgata's Dharma is also like this. It manifests the practices of wisdom according to the good roots planted in the vessels of the people. It naturally appears. These are the seven things.
Then he spoke in verse:
Just as the heavenly palaces of the form and formless realms are established first,
And then the palaces of the desire realm flourish,
And then the land is formed, the abodes of the people,
And all the various beings, the dragons, and the gandharvas.
The ten powers are also like this, originally already spontaneously responding,
Cultivating without boundaries, the demeanor of a bodhisattva,
Then, in the jeweled stillness, established through causes and conditions,
Next, in attaining mastery, and then extending to sentient beings.
After the rain drops fall, there is no blue or yellow,
The water then enters the earth, giving rise to various things,
Due to the earth's desire, it gives rise to trees, mountains, and forests,
The water is not various, but the names of the seeds in the earth are.
The guides abide in the truth, their wisdom fully penetrating the sagely,
Their compassionate wisdom is like space, upholding skillful means.
Like the supreme Dharma, they enter this offering,
Their wisdom free from defilements, their body dwelling nowhere.
Furthermore, child of the Buddha!

Just as when a water disaster occurs, it is the same in the empty space. This trichiliocosm then has a lotus flower called Perfect Virtue Jewel, which naturally arises in various kinds, completely covering the water disaster and illuminating the world.

If the lotus flower naturally appears, the great honored celestial sons and the pure abode celestials, upon seeing this flower, will then know that in this kalpa there will be so many equally enlightened ones arising.
There is a natural wind called Manifest Radiance that arises and moves, and it has already established the palaces and abodes of the celestial sons of the form realm.
There is also a wind called Pure Manifest Illumination, which is peaceful, pure, and establishes the palaces and abodes of the celestial sons who practice in the desire realm.
There is also a wind called Uniform, which is indestructible and establishes the great iron enclosure mountain and the vajra mountain.
There is also a wind called Especially Honored, which blows and establishes Mount Sumeru, the king of mountains.

There is also a wind called long-standing, which blows and establishes the seven great treasure mountain kings: first, Yintuoli, second, Yici Shan, third, Chuhui Jian, fourth, Chuyuluo, fifth, Tuohua Min Suoli, sixth, Mulin, Damulinf, and seventh, Xiangshan, Bingshan.
There is also a wind called good dwelling, which establishes the great earth.
There is also a wind called strict purity, which establishes the palaces and houses of the gods, dragons, and gandharvas who roam the earth.
There is also a wind called inexhaustible intention, which establishes the entire ocean abyss of the three thousand worlds.
There is also a wind called illuminating treasury, which establishes the wish-fulfilling jewel of the universal world.
There is also a wind called firm root, which blows and establishes the tree of clothing.
Thus, good man!
The great rain is of one taste.
Moreover, that water is without thought, attaining the natural number of all dharmas, causing sentient beings to separately know the basis of virtue.
Thus, those various winds are distinguished and understood through the various winds in the trichiliocosm.

The TathÄgata, Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened One, therefore embraces all bases of virtue, accomplishes all dharmas, and accumulates unsurpassed, limitless wisdom, becoming the foremost in the world without cutting off the TathÄgata's lineage.
Displaying limitless majestic spiritual light, universally illuminating the world, pervading everywhere, those who see the light all with a sincere mind turn towards the TathÄgata.
Moreover, this great sage is unobstructed, and the various bodhisattvas each think to themselves:
'Now the TathÄgata's reason for appearing is to transform the bodhisattvas, therefore he manifests his body in this world.
The TathÄgata's light of wisdom, which is called 'Universal Illumination,' illuminates the inconceivable Dharma realm and the lineage of right enlightenment.

There is a light path called 'All-Pervading,' and therefore the TathÄgata brings about the wisdom of all spiritual powers, and none do not follow his teachings.

There is a light of wisdom called unequaled. The TathÄgata uses this to cross over the Dharma canon, all the same as the realm of emptiness, and in the Buddha's land, with immeasurable lifespan, to achieve the ultimate.
In this way, good man!

The TathÄgata's Dharma rain is of one flavor. The TathÄgata's field of wisdom has no thoughts. It reveals the Dharma of attaining the Way for bodhisattvas and preaches the sÅ«tras according to the capacities of sentient beings.
The wisdom of the TathÄgata is all of one kind, and the light of the holy path is equal without distinction. Therefore, the TathÄgata appears in the world.
Buddha's disciple!

Observe that the TathÄgata attains the flavor of one liberation, and manifests and reveals immeasurable and inconceivable pure virtues, causing sentient beings to all see and know them. They are all established by the great sage.
Moreover, he wants to cause the TathÄgata to manifest the Dharma without establishing anything, but it has never existed.
If he causes one person to be transformed up to the unsurpassed, then the TathÄgata together manifests the basis of virtue.
If one is able to understand the virtue of the TathÄgata, and contemplate and attain wisdom, it has never existed.

The holy purport of the TathÄgata surpasses all dharmas, and therefore he manifests and reveals for the sake of sentient beings, causing them to enter this meaning and understand the Dharma without being content.
The TathÄgata has no thoughts and no recollection, nothing accomplished and nothing brought forth, nothing created and nothing not created.
He has no creator and comes from nowhere, yet he appears, and this is the eighth thing.
Then he spoke in verse:
Just as a lotus flower emerges, so does the Buddha's enlightenment appear.
The delighted devas have seen past buddhas,
And where there is water, the palace is clear and bright.
In this world, it will not be long before each has their own country.
The true good light of the Buddha is the original auspicious response.
What the bodhisattvas think is understood by all.
Their wisdom and cognition are pure, and their bodies are fresh and spotless.
The ten powers save all crawling creatures, and they contemplate and practice the buddhas' teachings.
They understand the immeasurable created karma that exists in the world.
Still on the ground of causes, the earth is on the surface of the water,
All dwelling in empty space, this is called the great palace.
Two-legged and four-legged beings all rely on it,
The Honored One among humans is like this, having already attained to be the Dharma King.
For the sake of all without remainder, beings are supported and relied upon,
Those who see or hear it all take refuge and attend to it.
Destroying the dust of desire, the work relied upon by beings,
Up to the Brahma Heaven, and to the boundless limit.
Who, for the sake of beings, wishes to bring peace to the common people?
One should not shine for the deluded, but seek wisdom,
Without analogy, it is used as an analogy, the most victorious, therefore it is seen.
Furthermore, child of the Buddha!
It is like establishing four winds in the sky to hold the water element.
What are the four?
The four winds are the abiding wind, the rising wind, the guiding wind, and the firm and pervasive wind.
The earth rests on the water, and the water does not move or shake, this is called the power of the earth.
The water rests on the wind, and the wind stands in space, space has no support, and for this reason, the trichiliocosm has a place to exist.
In this way, good man!
If the TathÄgata appears in the world, without obstruction, with the light of wisdom, there will be four boundless wisdom fields for the four assemblies, upholding the roots of virtue of all beings.
What are the four?

First, the wisdom field of timely joy for the masses; second, the wisdom field of establishing the causes and conditions of all dharmas; third, the wisdom field of protecting the roots of virtue and fully accomplishing all actions; fourth, abiding in the realm of no outflows and beholding the wisdom field;
these are the four wisdom fields, with which all beings are nurtured.
Great compassion means to deliver all beings;
Great pity means to roar the lion's roar.

By being able to establish great compassion and great pity, one discerns the various thoughts and inclinations of sentient beings, abides in skillful means, and establishes compassionate practices. This is called the TathÄgata's arising and manifestation.
Moreover, the TathÄgata is unobstructed, with the wisdom of holy realization dwelling nowhere. This is the ninth dharma.
Then he spoke in verse:
Just like the realm of space, which has no limits,
It encompasses the realms of form and formlessness, and is immeasurable.
In the eight directions, above and below, the Buddha's lands and all bodies,
Without exception in the three realms, this is the realm of space.
The supreme bodies are like this, universally manifesting,
Observing the realms of phenomena, where existence and non-existence are located.
The body of the Great Sage is revered, and no one can see it,
If one sees the guides, one is enlightened according to the precepts.
Furthermore, child of the Buddha!

Just as the trichiliocosm is vast and limitless, the various kinds of beings have various practices. If there are expedient means, they are not apart from space, either in the water, on the ground, or in lotuses, which are innumerable and each have their own expedient means;
Or they are in the palaces of the various heavens, in the palace of the Heaven of Free Enjoyment of Manifestations by Others;
Or they are in space, freely enjoying themselves due to space.
In this way, good sir!
If the TathÄgata gathers and manifests, all beings see and revere him.

If there are those who see him, they rejoice and leap for joy, freely enjoying themselves according to the time. They abide in the power of enlightenment, continue to practice precepts, enjoy vast deeds, and attain the sageliness of the world.

With spiritual powers and wisdom, they have no physical body and expound the unobstructed gateway to the holy realization. Cultivating this karma, they expound and manifest self-mastery, without losing karmic retribution. Their teachings are radiant, guiding and benefiting all dharmas. Relying on the great transformation, they do not forget anything.
This is called the TathÄgata's manifestation of gathering in, with all sentient beings revering and looking up to him. This is the Dharma of the ten powers.
This is it, Buddha's disciple!

The TathÄgata, the Worthy One, the Perfectly Enlightened One, for the sake of the bodhisattvas, manifests and expounds the Dharma, with a place to return to, immeasurable, without negligence, and also not playful.
The mind and consciousness that arise return to the absence of a body, naturally like emptiness;
Understanding sentient beings is then natural, not calculating a self, not having a limit;
All buddha lands have no land, all lands are empty, returning without retreating and not ceasing.
In the future, there will be no joy, as the holy wisdom of the TathÄgata has no factions, returning to non-duality, with form and without form, with and without activity, all dharmas are equal.

If one penetrates all beings, following and cultivating the great path, freely engaging in activities, this is what was encouraged in the past, and one will then be able to fully possess this wonderful elegance.
This is it, Buddha's disciple!
